meanings.definition: A vacuum tube that converts light into an electric current.
meanings.sent1: The phototube captured the sunlight and turned it into electricity.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use a phototube to measure the brightness of stars.
meanings.sent3: The phototube was so hungry for light, it gobbled up every sunbeam in sight!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a phototube, brightening up the room with its electric energy.
meanings.sent5: The phototube hummed with power as it transformed light into a useful current.

meanings.definition: A device used to detect and measure light intensity.
meanings.sent1: The phototube on the camera helped adjust the exposure for the perfect picture.
meanings.sent2: The phototube indicated that the room was too dark for reading.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous phototube played hide-and-seek with the light, making it hard to measure.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like phototubes, always sensing the slightest changes in brightness.
meanings.sent5: The phototube beeped softly as it registered the light intensity in the room.

meanings.definition: A type of electronic sensor that responds to light.
meanings.sent1: The phototube in the security system triggered the alarm when it detected movement.
meanings.sent2: Phototubes are commonly used in automatic light switches to save energy.
meanings.sent3: The phototube blushed when it sensed the spotlight on it, feeling like a celebrity.
meanings.sent4: His intuition was like a phototube, always reacting to the light of truth.
meanings.sent5: The phototube chirped happily as it picked up the incoming light signals.
